Blood Hawk

This creature appears as a hawk with red talons and a dull red beak.



Blood Hawk

CR 1

XP 600
N Small magical beast
Init +2; Senses darkvision 60 ft., low-light vision, scent; Perception +6
DEFENSE
AC 14, touch 13, flat-footed 13 (+2 Dex, +1 natural, +1 size)
hp 6 (1d10+1)
Fort +3, Ref +4, Will +2
OFFENSE
Spd 10 ft., fly 80 ft. (average)
Melee bite +4 (1d4), 2 talons +4 (1d3)
Space 5 ft.; Reach 5 ft.
STATISTICS
Str 11, Dex 15, Con 12, Int 2, Wis 14, Cha 6
Base Atk +1; CMB +1; CMD 13
Feats Weapon Finesse
Skills Fly +4, Perception +6 (+14 in daylight); Racial Modifiers +8 Perception in daylight
ECOLOGY
Environment Any forest, hills, plains, and mountains
Organization flock (6-11)
Treasure incidental


The blood hawk is nearly identical to a normal hawk and is often mistaken for one, but a blood hawk is stronger and far more aggressive than a normal hawk. Blood hawks love the taste of human flesh and are relentless in their hunt of human prey. They often steal gems from the corpses of their humanoid prey, which they use to line their nests.

Blood hawks are fierce combatants and quickly swoop down on their prey, attacking with their razor sharp talons and beak. Blood hawks fight to the death.
